title: Two pipes can fill a tank in 6 hours and 8 hours respectively. A third pipe can empty the same tank in 12 hours. If all the pipes start working together, how long it will take to fill the tank? - Quora

response.answer_text: One of the best ways to solve this will be to assume some capacity of the tank. No matter whatever capacity we take, the answer will still be the same. Now, to simplify the calculations, lets take the capacity of the tank to be an LCM(Least Common Multiple) of 6,8 and 12 which is 24 Litres. Now lets find the rate of each pipe (In terms of Litres/Hour) The rate of the first pipe= 24/6= 4 Litres/hour The rate of the second pipe=24/8= 3 Litres/hour The rate of the Third pipe=(-24/12) = -2 Litres/hour ( Make sure that I have used the minus sign because the water is being removed through this pipe) The next step is easy… Just add them and you will get the final rate when the pipes work together!! = 4 + 3 + (-2) = 5 Litres/hour. Now, if a pipe of rate 1 Litre/hour fills a tank of capacity 24 Litres in 24 hours, Then, a pipe of rate 5 Litres/hour fills a tank of capacity 24 litres in 24/5= 4.8 hours. And that’s your final answer! I used 24 Litre Capacity of the tank for simplicity, you can also assume it be x and then solve using the same method I used. You will get the same answer because in the final step the x will be divided by itself.

Pipe A is filling the tank at 1/6 (4/24) rate per hour. Pipe B is filling the tank at 1/8 (3/24) rate per hour The combined Filling rates of Pipe A & B = 7/24 per hour Pipe C can empty the the tank at a rate of Minus 1/12 or 2/24 per hour. Therefore the readjusted filling rate is 7/24 minus 2/24 per hour = Readjusted Net Gain of ‘Filling’ is now only 5/24 per hourdivided by 5 = 4.8 hours or 4 hours & 48 minutes to fill the tank.

Let us assumePipe-A fill the tank in,6- hours, Pipe-B in 7- hours andPipe-C can empty in 12- hours,then In 1- hour the part of the tank filled = 1/6 + 1/8- 1/12= (4+3–2)/24= 5/24Therefore the complete tank will be filled in = 24/5=4 & 4/5- hours (or)4- hours & 48- minutes.
(1/6)+(1/8)-(1/12) = (12+9–6)/72 = 15/72 = 5/24 The tank will be filled in 24/5 or 4.8 hours is all the three pipes are open at the same time.
